channel.title: Help with Win7 64 bit?
channel.description:
I get this problem with all clients unless it is not a run.bat file... when I try to use it, it says "Java is not a recognized something something something" I have a code that makes run.bat files for clients work, as it has on different servers. The code is @echo off title Client cd ./Class/ "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx200m Jframe 30 0 lowmem members 32 pause
and you edit the run.bat and replace the language there with that. But it just gives me a long line of java errors. I have windows 64 BIT. Not 32! [IMG]http://i584.photobucket.com/albums/ss282/xscizorx/Untitled23.png[/img]

item.title: Help with Win7 64 bit?
item.dc:creator: @zkumfidus zkumfidus

@zkumfidus wrote:

i have the same problem :S

item.title: Help with Win7 64 bit?
item.dc:creator: @xscizorx xscizorx
item.description:
@xscizorx wrote:

I get this problem with all clients unless it is not a run.bat file…
when I try to use it, it says “Java is not a recognized something something something”
I have a code that makes run.bat files for clients work, as it has on different servers.
The code is
@echo off
title Client
cd ./Class/
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe” -Xmx200m Jframe 30 0 lowmem members 32
pause

and you edit the run.bat and replace the language there with that. But it just gives me a long line of java errors. I have windows 64 BIT. Not 32!

Read full topic
